short_summary: Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has a requirement for 1 566 300 Badges (various types)
description: The procurement will occur in two phases: Phase 1, an expression of interest by the interested bidder and Phase 2, the solicitation with the specific details of the requirement
full_summary:
# M7594-241973 NPP Badges Woven

## Government of Canada Tender Announcement
### Reference Number: WS4465415067-Doc4500206494

#### Solicitation Ending Date
The solicitation for the National Project Plan (NPP) Badges Woven has been cancelled as per the Canadian government's decision.

#### Tender Overview
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) sought a supplier who could provide 1 566 300 Badges (various types), woven in accordance with the RCMP's Specification No: G.S. 1045-266 dated 2023-12-18. The requirement covered a term of five years and included As and When quantities.

#### Geographic Scope and Limitations 
This project was limited to the procurement of Canadian goods, in compliance with Article 503.4 (b) of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement.

#### Procurement Methodology 
The proposed procurement was to occur in two phases, including an expression of interest from interested bidders (Phase 1), followed by a formal solicitation with specific requirements (Phase 2).

#### Key Details 

- **Supplier Profile:** The successful supplier was required to have demonstrated expertise and experience in the manufacture of woven badges.

- **Geographic Scope**: The supplier was expected to deliver goods to the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) station or location as determined by the RCMP.

- **Tariff and Trade:** All goods procured were subject to the terms of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement and all applicable regional trade agreements.

- **Miscellaneous:**

    + The Canadian government retains the right to modify or alter the procurement process at any given time.
    + The proposed procurement may not necessarily proceed to subsequent procurement phases unless otherwise stated.
    + Canada does not pledge to purchase any goods arising from this project-and makes no promises regarding the terms, conditions, or duration of subsequent procurements.

#### Contact Information
Individuals interested in this project may contact Mathieu Hevey from the Public Services and Procurement Canada at **mathieu.hevey@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca** for further information.

**Additional Resources:** The full solicitation document is available online at <https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19177048?extsite=MTkxNzcwNDhfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==>.
